title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.12.5 | 2-08-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare, Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
segments.summary: The lecture begins with the chanting of various Vaishnava mantras and prayers.

segments.key_quote: News even reached the celestial planets about Maharaj Yudhishthira's worldly possessions.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verse from Srimad Bhagavatam (1.12.5) and explains that the fame of King Yudhishthira's worldly possessions and good deeds reached even the heavenly planets.

segments.key_quote: Yudhishthira was so perfectly ruling...in accordance with the instructions given by Krishna.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on King Yudhishthira's perfect rule and how his good administration was so exceptional that it garnered attention even in the heavenly planets, where they usually don't pay attention to earthly affairs.

segments.key_quote: There is life on each and every planet in this universe.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the significance of the word 'loka' and emphasizes that life exists on every planet in the universe, contrary to the modern scientific view, and that Vedic literature provides accurate descriptions of these higher planets.

segments.key_quote: Those who worship Krishna they are eligible to be transferred to Krishna's planet.
segments.summary: The speaker explains the different destinations one can attain after death based on their worship, referencing Bhagavad Gita 9.25, and clarifies that one cannot forcefully enter the higher planets without following natural laws and qualifying oneself.

segments.key_quote: One must qualify himself to enter into such happy planets by sacrifice and service.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the importance of sacrifice (Yajna) and service (Seva) to qualify for entering the higher planets, highlighting that these planets are free from sinful activities.

segments.key_quote: So this is not at all proper for such people to think that they can travel by some spacecraft to the higher planets where the standard of living is thousands and millions of times better than the best standard of living on the earth.
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts the sinful activities on Earth, particularly animal killing, with the purity of the higher planets, emphasizing that one cannot reach those planets through mere technological advancement but through scriptural recommendations.

The speaker explains that King Yudhishthira's proper execution of duties led to earthly abundance and reiterates that forceful entrance into higher planets through space travel is not possible, as it's driven by sense gratification.

segments.key_quote: It's the worst kind of sin, the greatest sin.
segments.summary: The speaker condemns cow killing as the greatest sin, describing the severe punishment awaiting those who commit it, and offers Krishna consciousness as a means of relief from sinful reactions.
